ygData.messageBody:
Aye, it seemed like his mind was well made up, heh... I had continued to put
forth my view on things long after I had realized that it was pointless to
try and convince him just so any other readers of the board out there could
see the other side. I don't want 1 guy knocking bards (even if they make
fools of themselves doing it) and other people seeing it and maybe being
swayed by it. Thank you Silky for backing me up there, so people see it's
not just 2 differing opinions. I hope it's not too far down the list to not
get any readership. Maybe they need a counter on each post... hmmmmmmmmmm
: )

There is a more recent post on the same board with a new bard requesting
info. I responded with the onelist address.... If our membership is only
300, there has to be at least a 1000 more bards out there that aren't
getting the valuable information that's on this list. Maybe the moderator
(I forget who it is right now, heh) could get EQVault to reference the
onelist URL again to drum up some more membership. I think the worst thing
to any class (especially one that's a little more difficult to understand
like a Bard) is somebody playing it that doesn't really know what they're
doing. If it's the first experience with that class, people they group with
may just assume that the Class is bad, not the player....

Darkfox - 4 bubbles from Darkfox Reven'tsol
Xegony

Let no Bard go Uneducated! : )

>I read that thread, the guy simply didn't have a clue. You pointed it out
>time and again that the bigger the group, the more effective a bard is,
>and he just refused to see it. I held off jumping in because he had made
>up his mind, and no amount of discussion was going to change it.
